---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #17750

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks!

bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11729389882/job/32674903383)

Can you please merge master and fix the error? Thanks!

bors d+

:v: Vtec234 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11729990856/job/32676835213)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11729990856/job/32676835692)

maintainer merge

apart from that. Thanks!
Thanks for the PR!

maintainer merge

apart from that. Thanks!
This seems to be tagged with `large-import`. I initially split out the Jacobson results into a separate file, but decided it was too small to deserve a standalone existence.
The impirt increase is *huge* though. Can you find a better way? maybe with a pereliminary split to an existing file?
What do you mean by 'preliminary split to an existing file'? (Btw, while I agree 28% is large, note that I just added this file in #17750 and the intent was always to add the content added here.)
Oh I hadn't noticed it xas a leaf file. Then >i'd say it's fine

```suggestion
  obtain rfl | qj := eq_or_ne q j
```

```suggestion
    · simp [ij, N, zMx, stdBasisMatrix, mul_apply, sum_apply, ite_and, sub_mul]
```

```suggestion
      simp [ij, N, zMx, stdBasisMatrix, mul_apply, sum_apply, ite_and, sub_mul]
```

```suggestion
  · simp [N, qj, sum_apply, mul_apply]
```
This begs for a `membership` aesop-like tactic 😁

```suggestion
private lemma jacobson_matricesOver_le (I : TwoSidedIdeal R) :
```
since it's superseded by the result below
Can you provide the version with Jacobson bot?

Do you just mean
```lean
theorem jacobson_matricesOver_bot :
    ((⊥ : TwoSidedIdeal R).matricesOver n).jacobson =
    (⊥ : TwoSidedIdeal R).jacobson.matricesOver n :=
  jacobson_matricesOver ⊥
```
? I suppose I could, but it seems too trivial to extract as a standalone theorem?
Okay I might be hallucinating but is "matrices over bot" just bot?
Oh yes I see, added something.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/Matrix): characterize Jacobson radicals in matrix rings
